name: Imposter Oak's Revenge

historicalClassification.note: Originally printed as a Trainer. Would be classified as Supporter by modern rules due to its powerful hand disruption effect.

effect.text: Discard a card from your hand in order to play this card. Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 4 cards.

tips: Use when opponent has a large hand
The discard cost can be turned into an advantage with cards like Item Finder
Forces opponent to shuffle away their carefully drawn cards

competitiveHistory: Imposter Oak's Revenge was a powerful hand disruption card. The discard cost was minor compared to potentially wiping out an opponent's hand of 7+ cards down to just 4. It saw play in control decks alongside other disruption cards like Rocket's Sneak Attack and Lass.

rulings.ruling: You must discard a card from your hand to play this card. If you have no other cards in hand, you cannot play it.
Your opponent shuffles their entire hand into the deck before drawing 4 new cards.
